text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The response explicitly addresses the applicable law test for counterclaims under Section III ('Applicable Law to Counterclaims'). It outlines the competing approaches (BIT-Only vs. Domestic Law Permitted) and notes the increasing trend toward a hybrid approach where domestic law counterclaims are admissible if they relate to the same transaction, with the tribunal applying domestic law to inform the BIT claim. This directly covers the requirement that the counterclaim must be grounded in obligations applicable under domestic law and/or international law as determined by the treaty and procedural rules.", "criterion_id": "47ddb755-e7f6-4ead-a8aa-80db8a87a3b9"}
